body: Define a determinant and explain its significance in solving linear equations.
Calculate the determinant of the matrix $A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 4 \\ -1 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$.
Explain the properties of determinants of order 2 and provide examples.
Evaluate $\begin{vmatrix} 3 & -1 & 4 \\ 2 & 0 & 5 \\ 1 & 3 & 6 \end{vmatrix}$.
If $A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$, find the value of $|A|$.
Show that the determinant of a triangular matrix is the product of its diagonal elements.
Calculate the determinant of $A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 3 & 1 \\ 0 & 1 & 4 \\ 5 & 2 & 0 \end{bmatrix}$.
Find the area of the triangle with vertices at $(1, 2), (3, 5), (4, -1)$.
Evaluate the determinant $\begin{vmatrix} 0 & \sin \theta & -\cos \theta \\ -\sin \theta & 0 & \cos \theta \\ \cos \theta & -\sin \theta & 0 \end{vmatrix}$.
If $|A| = 5$, find the value of $|3A|$ for a 3x3 matrix $A$.
Explain how determinants are used to check the consistency of a system of linear equations.
Evaluate $\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 0 & -2 \\ -1 & 3 & 4 \\ 2 & -3 & 1 \end{vmatrix}$.
Find the values of $x$ for which the system $\begin{cases} 2x + y = 5 \\ x - 3y = -2 \end{cases}$ has no unique solution.
If the determinant of a matrix $A$ is zero, what does this imply about $A$?
Find the minors and cofactors of each element in $\begin{bmatrix} 4 & 3 \\ 2 & 1 \end{bmatrix}$.
Verify that $\begin{vmatrix} 2 & -3 \\ 4 & -6 \end{vmatrix} = 0$ and interpret the result.
Show that the points $(1, 2), (3, 4), (5, 6)$ are collinear using determinants.
Find the inverse of $A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix}$ using determinants.
Compute $\begin{vmatrix} x & 1 \\ 2 & 3 \end{vmatrix}$ and solve for $x$ if the determinant is $5$.
Explain how to find the area of a triangle using determinants if given the vertices.
Evaluate $\begin{vmatrix} 3 & 2 & 1 \\ 0 & -1 & 4 \\ 2 & 3 & 5 \end{vmatrix}$.
If $A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 2 & 3 \\ 4 & 5 & 6 \\ 7 & 8 & 9 \end{bmatrix}$, show that $|A| = 0$.
Prove that $\begin{vmatrix} \cos \theta & \sin \theta \\ -\sin \theta & \cos \theta \end{vmatrix} = 1$.
Use determinants to show that the points $(3, 0), (7, 2), (9, 6)$ are collinear.
Evaluate $\begin{vmatrix} \sin x & \cos x \\ \cos x & -\sin x \end{vmatrix}$.
Find the value of $k$ if the determinant $\begin{vmatrix} 3 & k \\ 5 & 2 \end{vmatrix} = 10$.
Evaluate the determinant $\begin{vmatrix} 4 & -3 & 2 \\ 0 & 5 & -1 \\ 7 & 2 & -6 \end{vmatrix}$.
If $|A| = -2$ for a 2x2 matrix, find $|2A|$.
Show that the matrix $A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -1 \end{bmatrix}$ is its own inverse.
